posts.post_content:
I ended up with 4 of these after purchasing the Kjeldoran Cunning Pre-fab deck.  
I can see this working with [Reinforcements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reinforcements) provided you've got them in your graveyard to begin with. Using deck manipulation spells to force a ripple effect doesn't seem viable. Apart from the unlikely ripple potential, it's an overpriced [Elvish Archers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Archers)

Posted By: A3Kitsune (1/11/2010 10:05:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Ripple cards were basically designed for limited because most stores weren't stocked with Ice Age or Fallen Empires boosters (or they were prohibitively expensive to use for sealed). This resulted in most Coldsnap sealed formats being Coldsnap alone, so the variance of cards was much lower than normal. Ripple was thus quite potent in that format (but the constructed applications were extremely limited).
posts.html:

Ripple was thus quite potent in that format (but the constructed applications were extremely limited).
